intro: Mapouria deplanchei, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
